data.title: Catherine Zeta-Jones's Husband and Relationship History
data.meta_description: Who is Catherine Zeta-Jones dating? Who Catherine Zeta-Jones dated; list of Catherine Zeta-Jones loves, ex boyfriends; breakup rumors.. The loves, exes and ...
data.text:
Catherine Zeta-Jones and Michael Douglas first crossed paths at the Deauville Film Festival in France in August 1998, where a mutual friend introduced them. The captivating couple embarked on their legendary romance soon after, bonding over their shared interest in film and their nearly identical birthdays - which are a day apart - and became engaged in December 1999. Their highly-publicized wedding took place at the Plaza Hotel in New York City on November 18, 2000, and the glamorous duo has remained Hollywood's golden couple ever since. Sharing two children, Dylan and Carys, they’ve weathered various trials, including Michael’s battle with cancer and a brief separation in 2013, but have ultimately remained united and supportive of each other.

A world-renowned actor and producer, Michael Douglas hails from an established Hollywood family as the son of iconic actor Kirk Douglas. With a storied career spanning over four decades, Michael is best known for his roles in films such as Wall Street, Fatal Attraction, and Basic Instinct. He has numerous accolades to his name, including two Academy Awards and five Golden Globes. Before his relationship with Catherine, Michael was previously married to Diandra Luker from 1977 to 2000, with whom he shares a son named Cameron.

Before meeting her husband, Catherine Zeta-Jones briefly dated the Simply Red frontman, Mick Hucknall, in the mid-1990s. Rumor has it that the pair met at a London party, and subsequently enjoyed a short-lived but passionate love affair. Although their romance was fleeting, Catherine reportedly left a lasting impression on the British singer-songwriter, who later penned the ballad “Holding Back the Years” in her honor. Despite its brevity, their relationship undoubtedly holds a special place in the annals of celebrity dating history.

As the lead singer and songwriter of the British rock band Simply Red, Mick Hucknall became a prominent figure in the music world during the 1980s and 1990s. His distinctive voice and soulful style helped propel the group to international success, with hit singles like "If You Don't Know Me By Now" and "Money's Too Tight (To Mention)." Over the span of his career, Mick has been linked to various high-profile women, including Helena Christensen, Brigitte Nielsen, and Steffi Graf.

Catherine Zeta-Jones reportedly shared a brief romance with Hollywood producer Jon Peters in the early stages of her career. The two allegedly met at a party in Los Angeles, where they were introduced by mutual friends. Their budding relationship was said to be a classic "whirlwind romance," filled with glamorous Hollywood events and intimate moments spent in Jon's Malibu estate. Although their love affair ultimately fizzled out, both went on to find lasting partnerships with other notable industry figures.

Jon Peters first rose to prominence as a legendary hairdresser before transitioning into a successful career as a film producer. With numerous blockbusters under his belt, Jon is known for producing films such as Batman, Superman Returns, and A Star is Born. His storied personal life includes a high-profile marriage to actress Lesley Ann Warren, as well as relationships with Barbra Streisand and Pamela Anderson.

In the late 1990s, Catherine Zeta-Jones was romantically involved with Scottish actor Angus Macfadyen. Sparks flew, as they soon embarked on a passionate off-screen romance. Although their relationship ultimately ran its course, both actors have enjoyed successful careers in the years that followed.

Angus Macfadyen is a versatile actor with an impressive resume that spans film, television, and theater. He rose to fame with his role as Robert the Bruce in the critically acclaimed film Braveheart, and has since appeared in numerous high-profile projects, including the television series Turn: Washington's Spies and The Lost City of Z. Angus has been involved with other noteworthy actresses in Hollywood, such as Melanie Lynskey and Francesca Annis.

During the early 1990s, Catherine Zeta-Jones reportedly had a brief but passionate liaison with English actor Paul McGann. While their relationship allegedly bloomed, their union was ultimately short-lived. Despite the brevity of their affair, both performers have continued to enjoy successful acting careers.

Paul McGann is a prominent figure in the realm of British television and film. He gained fame for his leading role in the cult classic Withnail & I, and later earned critical acclaim for his portrayal of the Eighth Doctor in Doctor Who. Over the years, Paul has been linked to an array of talented actresses, including Susannah Harker and Amanda Mealing.

Catherine Zeta-Jones was briefly involved with Scottish television presenter John Leslie in the early 1990s. The pair first crossed paths while Catherine was still establishing herself as a television actress in the UK. Though the romance was short-lived, it reportedly left a lasting impression on John, who has spoken fondly of their time together in interviews. Their relationship remains a lesser-known chapter in Catherine's romantic history.

John Leslie began his career as a popular television presenter in the United Kingdom, appearing on shows such as Wheel of Fortune and This Morning. Over the years, he has maintained ties to the world of entertainment, both as a presenter and as a radio host. John's love life has also made headlines on occasion; he has dated several high-profile women, including British actress Abi Titmuss.
